wikipedia_page.main: Kenneth "Ken" David Bowman (6 March 1937 – 10 October 2013) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for , Heworth A.R.L.F.C., Huddersfield and Bradford Northern, as a wing, or second-row, i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested scrums, he died from cancer in The Wirral.

link_mentions.page: List of Great Britain national rugby league team players

response: * Kenneth Bowman (1937–2013), English rugby league footballer
Heworth has produced many players who went on to play the game professionally, most notably former internationals Geoff Wriglesworth, Kenneth Bowman, Colin Forsyth, David Watkinson and Gary Divorty.
